DOC.brief_summary: This study pilot , multi-centered , randomize , clinical trial evaluate safety efficacy perform early Coronary Angiography ( CAG ) versus early CAG post-cardiac arrest patient without ST segment elevation . Safety assess evaluate association major adverse event ( re-arrest , bleeding , pulmonary edema , hypotension , acute renal insufficiency , pneumonia ) early coronary angiogram . Efficacy assess composite endpoint improve leave ventricular regional global function ( regional wall motion analysis leave ventricular ejection fraction ) measure echocardiography prior hospital discharge favourable neurological function ( Cerebral Performance Categories 1 2 ) discharge .
DOC.brief_title: Early Coronary Angiography Versus Delayed Coronary Angiography
DOC.detailed_description: Cardiac arrest major public health issue . Arizona leader improve long-term survival introduce new innovative resuscitation approach include `` Chest Compression-Only CPR '' `` Cardiocerebral Resuscitation '' . Post-resuscitation care next great opportunity improvement . Early coronary angiography ( CAG ) combine therapeutic hypothermia become recommend standard care post-cardiac arrest patient manifest ST segment elevation electrocardiogram ( ECG ) . However , majority cardiac arrest victim ST segment elevation . There clinical equipoise whether patient benefit early CAG . Subjects qualify study randomize 1:1 one two group . ° Intervention Group-Early coronary angiography ( door-to-angiography ) within 120 minute admission Emergency Department . ° Control Group-No early coronary angiography ( within first six hour admission ) All enrolled patient , treat therapeutic hypothermia standard care , begin simultaneously group within least 2 hour hospital arrival . Subject follow 180 day safety long-term survival .
DOC.criteria: 1 . All successfully resuscitate outofhospital cardiac arrest patient suspect cardiac etiology nontraumatic arrest 2 . Age great 18 year 3 . The post resuscitation ECG show evidence ST segment elevation 1 . Nonresuscitated ( sustain pulse BP ) 2 . Presence ST segment elevation new leave bundle branch block present postresuscitation ECG 3 . Suspected noncardiac etiology arrest respiratory failure , asphyxia , pulmonary embolus , shock , trauma , drug overdose , CNS bleed likely cause cardiac arrest 4 . Known `` Do Not Resuscitate '' status 5 . Minors ( < 18 year old ) 6 . Prisoners 7 . Significant bleed blunt trauma 8 . Known confirmed pregnancy test urinalysis 9 . Patients know received investigational therapy within 30 day prior enrollment study duration exclude unless study review approve Study Steering Committee . 10 . Known `` opt '' choice ; wear Optout band EFIC approve study `` Optout '' list
